intro: Cheiranthus knowleanus, commonly known as the Armenian candytuft, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features linear, glaucous leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
